metro.TrainManagement.Trains

Class Train

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • metro.TrainManagement.Trains.TrainTemplate
        • metro.TrainManagement.Trains.Train

  • public class Train
extends TrainTemplate
    A Train can carry passengers, costs a bit to buy and maintain it. The costs of maintaining will also increase every month by a given factor (_costsFactor) and there is a maximum amount of passengers per train as well. All data about the trains are stored in the ./data/trains.txt file and are read & parsed by the GameState class.
    Author:
    hauke

    • Constructor Detail

      • Train

        public Train(java.lang.String name,
     java.lang.String modelName,
     java.lang.String manufacturer,
     int price,
     int costs,
     float costsFactor,
     int passengers,
     float speed)
        Creates a new train with the following properties. Every data for the trains are in the ./data/trains.txt file and will be read & parsed by the GameState class.
        Parameters:
        name - The model name of the train which can be anything but mostly like "CT-1 (3)".
        modelName - The name of the train model like "CT-1".
        manufacturer - Manufacturer of the train.
        price - Price for buying the train.
        costs - Costs per month.
        costsFactor - Monthly increase of the costs.
        passengers - Maximum amount of passengers per train.
        speed - The speed in nodes per second.

      • Train

        public Train(TrainTemplate trainTemplate)
        Creates a new Train with the properties of the given one. This constructor constructs a copy if you want so.
        Parameters:
        trainTemplate - A train that should be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • setLine

        public void setLine(TrainLine line)
        Sets the line of this train.
        Parameters:
        line - The new line.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String newName)
        Sets the name of this train. The convention is _ so please be sure that your train has this name.
        Parameters:
        newName - The new name of the train from the format _.

      • getCurrPassenger

        public int getCurrPassenger()
        Returns:
        Gets the current amount of passenger that are traveling with this train.

      • getLine

        public TrainLine getLine()
        Returns:
        The train line this train is driving on.

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch sp,
        java.awt.Point offset)
        Draws the train on its train line.
        Parameters:
        sp - The sprite Batch to draw on.
        offset - The offset of the map.

      • drive

        public void drive(boolean move,
         float deltaTime)
        Moves the train based on the elapsed time since the last moving and its speed. Even if the train should not move, it's a good idea to call this method with a correct parameter in order to keep the time-calculation correct.
        Parameters:
        move - When true the train will move, when false the train wont move and just wait.
        deltaTime - The delta time (current time - last time of this method call) to determine the mved distance.

      • updatePositionNodes

        public void updatePositionNodes()
        Calculates new values for the current and next node of this train. It also updates the texture of the train.

      • adjustTexture

        private void adjustTexture()
        Calculates the rotation and position of the texture.

      • getMovedDistance

        private float getMovedDistance(float deltaTime)
        Calculates the distance of this train that it moved in the given time.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The time where the train has moved.
        Returns:
        The distance in amount of baseNetSpacing units.

      • calcPosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D calcPosition()
        Calculates the position of the train considering the relative position on the line.
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the train.

      • calcCurrentNode

        public java.awt.Point calcCurrentNode()
        Calculates the node this train visited at last. This uses the _ralitiveOnLine value of this train.
        Returns:
        The node this train is assigned to (the last visited node).

      • calcNextNode

        public java.awt.Point calcNextNode()
        Calculates the node this train will visit next. This uses the _ralitiveOnLine value of this train.
        Returns:
        The node the train will visit next.

      • getCurrentNode

        public java.awt.Point getCurrentNode()
        Gets the last node this train passed. This does not calculate it, please use calcCurrentNode() to update it.
        Returns:
        The node this train is assigned to (the last visited node).

      • getNextNode

        public java.awt.Point getNextNode()
        Gets the node this train will visit next. This does not calculate it, please use calcNextNode() to update it.
        Returns:
        The node the train will visit next.

      • getCurrentNode

        public java.awt.Point getCurrentNode(float deltaTime)
        Gets the two nodes that are around this train.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The elapsed time since last move.
        Returns:
        The node this train is assigned to (the last visited node).

      • getNextNode

        public java.awt.Point getNextNode(float deltaTime)
        Gets the two nodes that are ahead this train.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The elapsed time since last move.
        Returns:
        The node the train will visit next.

      • waitFor

        public void waitFor(long duration)
        Saves the time when the train can move on. This is used in the drive(boolean, float) method to prevent the train for driving.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration the train should wait at its position in milliseconds.
